intro: Clidemia chinantlana, commonly known as the Chinantla mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of southern Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom throughout the wet season. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane rainforests. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
